title: rChEA3: An R client for ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API
text: rChEA3 R client ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API. ChEA3 available online web server, rChEA3 provides access tool directly R, streamlining transcription factor enrichment workflow. Submit gene lists, retrieve TF rankings multiple evidence sources (ChIP-seq, co-expression, literature), integrate results R/Bioconductor analysis pipeline. package includes convenient functions query API, retrieve results across collections, prepare outputs downstream analysis, generate publication-ready figures.

title: rChEA3: An R client for ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API
text: section demonstrates typical workflow rChEA3, submitting gene list retrieving transcription factor enrichment results. examples illustrate interact ChEA3 API, explore different collections, visualize results clear, publication-ready format. start loading package:
code: library(rChEA3)

title: rChEA3: An R client for ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API
text: Provide vector gene symbols input. gene list consist HGNC-approved gene symbols, ChEA3 accepts standardized gene identifiers. Note: detailed information different ChEA3 collections underlying methodology, see Keenan et al., 2019.
code: genes <- c("TP53", "ESR1", "MYC", "NIPBL", "BRCA1") results <- queryChEA3(genes) #> Available results  #> ──────────────────────────────  #>   ► Integrated Results #>     ✔ Mean Rank — Average integrated ranks across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--meanRank"]] #>     ✔ Top Rank — Top integrated rank across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--topRank"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► ChIP-Seq #>     ✔ ENCODE — Interactions mined from the ENCODE project #>         Use <your_result>[["ENCODE--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ ReMap — Interactions mined from the ReMap project #>         Use <your_result>[["ReMap--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ Literature — Interactions mined from the literature #>         Use <your_result>[["Literature--ChIP-seq"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Coexpression #>     ✔ ARCHS4 — TF-target coexpression in the ARCHS4 dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["ARCHS4--Coexpression"]] #>     ✔ GTEx — TF-target coexpression in the GTEx dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["GTEx--Coexpression"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Co-occurrence #>     ✔ Enrichr — TF-target co-occurrence in Enrichr queries #>         Use <your_result>[["Enrichr--Queries"]] #>   ────────────────────

title: rChEA3: An R client for ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API
text: function displayTopN() allows quick inspection results showing top transcription factors collection. default, top 10 transcription factors displayed without applying thresholds.

what: 3. Extract the result for one particular collection
title: rChEA3: An R client for ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API
text: ChEA3 collection can accessed name. example, retrieve integrated ranking:
code: meanRank_results <- results[["Integrated--meanRank"]] head(meanRank_results) #>     Query Name Rank     TF Score #> 1 rChEA3_query    1  ZBED6 15.00 #> 2 rChEA3_query    2    PGR 41.25 #> 3 rChEA3_query    3    SON 45.50 #> 4 rChEA3_query    4 ZBTB21 46.50 #> 5 rChEA3_query    5   BPTF 58.50 #> 6 rChEA3_query    6   SPEN 58.50 #>                                                                            Library #> 1                                                           ARCHS4 Coexpression,15 #> 2 ARCHS4 Coexpression,24;Enrichr Queries,11;ReMap ChIP-seq,84;GTEx Coexpression,46 #> 3                                      ARCHS4 Coexpression,60;GTEx Coexpression,31 #> 4                                      ARCHS4 Coexpression,26;GTEx Coexpression,67 #> 5                                      ARCHS4 Coexpression,68;GTEx Coexpression,49 #> 6                                      ARCHS4 Coexpression,22;GTEx Coexpression,95 #>     Overlapping_Genes #> 1               NIPBL #> 2 MYC,BRCA1,ESR1,TP53 #> 3               NIPBL #> 4           NIPBL,MYC #> 5               NIPBL #> 6               NIPBL

title: rChEA3: An R client for ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API
code: visualizeRank(meanRank_results)

what: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: R client ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API. ChEA3 available online web server, rChEA3 provides access tool directly R, streamlining transcription factor enrichment workflow. Submit gene lists, retrieve TF rankings multiple evidence sources (ChIP-seq, co-expression, literature), integrate results R/Bioconductor analysis pipeline. package includes convenient functions query API, retrieve results across collections, prepare outputs downstream analysis, generate publication-ready figures.

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
code: install.packages("rChEA3")

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: can install development version rChEA3 GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak")  # if not already installed pak::pak("ckntav/rChEA3")  # or, alternatively: # install.packages("devtools")  # if not already installed devtools::install_github("ckntav/rChEA3")

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: quick example demonstrates conveniently interrogate ChEA3 tool.
code: library(rChEA3)

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: gene list consist HGNC-approved gene symbols, ChEA3 accepts standardized gene identifiers. function sends query gene list ChEA3 web server performs transcription factor enrichment analysis. analysis complete, available results different collections displayed. Note: detailed information different ChEA3 collections underlying methodology, see Keenan et al., 2019.
code: my_gene_list <- c("KLK3", "AR", "FKBP5", "TMPRSS2", "KLK2", "CYP1B1") results <- queryChEA3(my_gene_list) #> Available results  #> ──────────────────────────────  #>   ► Integrated Results #>     ✔ Mean Rank — Average integrated ranks across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--meanRank"]] #>     ✔ Top Rank — Top integrated rank across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--topRank"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► ChIP-Seq #>     ✔ ENCODE — Interactions mined from the ENCODE project #>         Use <your_result>[["ENCODE--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ ReMap — Interactions mined from the ReMap project #>         Use <your_result>[["ReMap--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ Literature — Interactions mined from the literature #>         Use <your_result>[["Literature--ChIP-seq"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Coexpression #>     ✔ ARCHS4 — TF-target coexpression in the ARCHS4 dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["ARCHS4--Coexpression"]] #>     ✔ GTEx — TF-target coexpression in the GTEx dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["GTEx--Coexpression"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Co-occurrence #>     ✔ Enrichr — TF-target co-occurrence in Enrichr queries #>         Use <your_result>[["Enrichr--Queries"]] #>   ────────────────────

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: function displayTopN() allows quick inspection results showing top-ranked transcription factors collection. default, top 10 transcription factors displayed every collection, without applying threshold score, p-value, FDR.

what: 3. Extract results from a specific collection
title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: function queryChEA3() returns list data frames, one ChEA3 collection. element list contains transcription factors (TFs) associated statistics (rank, score, p-value, FDR depending collection). access specific result table, use variable storing results specify corresponding collection name. tables can indexed name, explored, filtered, integrated downstream R/Bioconductor analyses. example, Mean Rank integrated results can retrieved : table contains averaged ranks transcription factors across ChEA3 libraries, providing global view TF enrichment gene set.
code: meanRank_results <- results[["Integrated--meanRank"]] head(meanRank_results) #>     Query Name Rank      TF Score #> 1 rChEA3_query    1   NKX31  3.00 #> 2 rChEA3_query    2 CREB3L4  3.00 #> 3 rChEA3_query    3  HOXB13  5.00 #> 4 rChEA3_query    4   MESP1 14.00 #> 5 rChEA3_query    5   HNF1B 28.33 #> 6 rChEA3_query    6   SPDEF 32.33 #>                                                                         Library #> 1                                     ARCHS4 Coexpression,1;GTEx Coexpression,5 #> 2                   ARCHS4 Coexpression,6;Enrichr Queries,2;GTEx Coexpression,1 #> 3 ARCHS4 Coexpression,5;Enrichr Queries,10;ReMap ChIP-seq,2;GTEx Coexpression,3 #> 4                ARCHS4 Coexpression,10;Enrichr Queries,16;GTEx Coexpression,16 #> 5                   ARCHS4 Coexpression,32;Enrichr Queries,21;ReMap ChIP-seq,32 #> 6                ARCHS4 Coexpression,11;Enrichr Queries,75;GTEx Coexpression,11 #>                   Overlapping_Genes #> 1        AR,TMPRSS2,KLK3,KLK2,FKBP5 #> 2 AR,TMPRSS2,CYP1B1,KLK3,KLK2,FKBP5 #> 3       AR,TMPRSS2,CYP1B1,KLK3,KLK2 #> 4       AR,TMPRSS2,CYP1B1,KLK3,KLK2 #> 5                    CYP1B1,TMPRSS2 #> 6       AR,TMPRSS2,CYP1B1,KLK3,KLK2

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: function visualizeRank() creates bar plot top-ranked transcription factors result table. default, plot displays significant TFs descending order, making easy quickly identify strongest candidates gene list.
code: visualizeRank(meanRank_results)

title: R Client for the ChEA3 Transcription Factor Enrichment API
text: Pull requests welcome. find bug, suggestion, want add feature, please open issue first discuss like change.

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
text: Example gene set downregulated (repressed) genes A549 cells dexamethasone treatment. keep dataset small suitable examples tests, first 15 downregulated gene symbols included .

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
code: a549_dex_downreg

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
text: character vector length 15, containing HGNC gene symbols.

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
text: Supplementary Table S3 Tav et al. (2023).

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
text: full list differentially expressed genes (activated repressed) provided Supplementary Table S3 Tav et al. (2023). raw Excel file can downloaded directly Frontiers Genetics: https://www.frontiersin.org/api/v4/articles/1237092/file/Table_3.XLSX/1237092_supplementary-materials_tables_3_xlsx/1. package, subset data first 15 repressed genes, stored object a549_dex_downreg.

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
text: Tav C, Fournier É, Fournier M, Khadangi F, Baguette , Côté MC, Silveira MAD, Bérubé-Simard F-, Bourque G, Droit , Bilodeau S (2023). "Glucocorticoid stimulation induces regionalized gene responses within topologically associating domains." Frontiers Genetics. doi:10.3389/fgene.2023.1237092

title: A549 Downregulated Genes (Dex) — a549_dex_downreg
code: # Load dataset data(a549_dex_downreg) a549_dex_downreg #>  [1] "MIR23AHG" "IER2"     "BHLHE40"  "IER3"     "PLK2"     "EDN1"     #>  [7] "NUAK2"    "HES1"     "GEM"      "IER5"     "MEGF6"    "MTCO2P12" #> [13] "DHRS3"    "PTAFR"    "EPHA2"

what: Print the top-n rows for each ChEA3 collection — displayTopN
title: Print the top-n rows for each ChEA3 collection — displayTopN
text: Print top-n rows ChEA3 collection

title: Print the top-n rows for each ChEA3 collection — displayTopN
code: displayTopN(   results,   n = 10,   columns = c("Rank", "TF", "Scaled Rank", "Set_name", "Intersect", "Score",     "FET p-value", "FDR", "Odds Ratio") )

title: Print the top-n rows for each ChEA3 collection — displayTopN
text: results named list data frames (output queryChEA3()). n Number rows show per table (default: 10). columns Optional character vector column names display (keeps intersection present data frame).

title: Print the top-n rows for each ChEA3 collection — displayTopN
text: (Invisibly) named list data frames, truncated first n rows (columns provided).

title: Print the top-n rows for each ChEA3 collection — displayTopN
code: # \donttest{     genes <- c("TP53", "MYC", "STAT3", "FOXO1", "BRCA1")     results <- queryChEA3(genes, verbose = FALSE)      # Display top 10 TFs from each collection     displayTopN(results) #> Top 10 per collection  #> ──────────────────────────────  #>   ► Integrated Results #>     ✔ Mean Rank - what: Export rChEA3 Results to Excel — exportResults
title: Export rChEA3 Results to Excel — exportResults
text: Write rChEA3 results object (named list data frames, one per collection) Excel workbook, one sheet per collection.

title: Export rChEA3 Results to Excel — exportResults
code: exportResults(   results,   output_dir,   output_file = "rChEA3_results",   with_date = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Export rChEA3 Results to Excel — exportResults
text: results named list data frames (e.g., return queryChEA3()), element corresponds ChEA3 collection (e.g., "Integrated–meanRank", "ENCODE–ChIP-seq", etc.). single data frame also accepted written one sheet. output_dir string specifying output directory. parameter required default. output_file Base file name (without extension). Default: "rChEA3_results". with_date Logical; TRUE, prepend today's date (ISO, YYYY-MM-DD) file name. Default: TRUE. verbose Logical; TRUE, print saved path. Default: TRUE.

title: Export rChEA3 Results to Excel — exportResults
text: (Invisibly) full path saved .xlsx file.

title: Export rChEA3 Results to Excel — exportResults
code: # \donttest{     data(a549_dex_downreg)     results <- queryChEA3(genes = a549_dex_downreg, query_name = "test_a549_dex_downreg") #> Available results  #> ──────────────────────────────  #>   ► Integrated Results #>     ✔ Mean Rank — Average integrated ranks across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--meanRank"]] #>     ✔ Top Rank — Top integrated rank across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--topRank"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► ChIP-Seq #>     ✔ ENCODE — Interactions mined from the ENCODE project #>         Use <your_result>[["ENCODE--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ ReMap — Interactions mined from the ReMap project #>         Use <your_result>[["ReMap--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ Literature — Interactions mined from the literature #>         Use <your_result>[["Literature--ChIP-seq"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Coexpression #>     ✔ ARCHS4 — TF-target coexpression in the ARCHS4 dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["ARCHS4--Coexpression"]] #>     ✔ GTEx — TF-target coexpression in the GTEx dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["GTEx--Coexpression"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Co-occurrence #>     ✔ Enrichr — TF-target co-occurrence in Enrichr queries #>         Use <your_result>[["Enrichr--Queries"]] #>   ────────────────────      exportResults(results,     output_dir = tempdir(),     output_file = "rChEA3_results_a549_dex_downreg.xlsx") #>  > rChEA3 results saved in /tmp/Rtmpj6UL3g/20251025_rChEA3_results_a549_dex_downreg.xlsx # }

what: Query ChEA3 API for TF enrichment — queryChEA3
title: Query ChEA3 API for TF enrichment — queryChEA3
text: #' Sends gene list ChEA3 web service identify enriched transcription factors using multiple evidence sources. gene list consist HGNC-approved gene symbols.

title: Query ChEA3 API for TF enrichment — queryChEA3
code: queryChEA3(genes, query_name = "rChEA3_query", verbose = TRUE)

title: Query ChEA3 API for TF enrichment — queryChEA3
text: genes Character vector HGNC gene symbols. query_name Optional query name (default: "rChEA3_query"). verbose Logical; TRUE, print grouped summary available result collections (default: TRUE).

title: Query ChEA3 API for TF enrichment — queryChEA3
text: named list data frames. element corresponds ChEA3 collection contains enrichment table transcription factors statistics. expected names : c("Integrated–meanRank", "Integrated–topRank", "GTEx–Coexpression", "ARCHS4–Coexpression", "ENCODE–ChIP-seq", "ReMap–ChIP-seq", "Literature–ChIP-seq", "Enrichr–Queries").

title: Query ChEA3 API for TF enrichment — queryChEA3
code: # \donttest{     results <- queryChEA3(c("SMAD9","FOXO1","MYC","STAT1","STAT3","SMAD3")) #> Available results  #> ──────────────────────────────  #>   ► Integrated Results #>     ✔ Mean Rank — Average integrated ranks across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--meanRank"]] #>     ✔ Top Rank — Top integrated rank across libraries #>         Use <your_result>[["Integrated--topRank"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► ChIP-Seq #>     ✔ ENCODE — Interactions mined from the ENCODE project #>         Use <your_result>[["ENCODE--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ ReMap — Interactions mined from the ReMap project #>         Use <your_result>[["ReMap--ChIP-seq"]] #>     ✔ Literature — Interactions mined from the literature #>         Use <your_result>[["Literature--ChIP-seq"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Coexpression #>     ✔ ARCHS4 — TF-target coexpression in the ARCHS4 dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["ARCHS4--Coexpression"]] #>     ✔ GTEx — TF-target coexpression in the GTEx dataset #>         Use <your_result>[["GTEx--Coexpression"]] #>   ────────────────────  #>   ► Co-occurrence #>     ✔ Enrichr — TF-target co-occurrence in Enrichr queries #>         Use <your_result>[["Enrichr--Queries"]] #>   ────────────────────      names(results) #> [1] "Integrated--meanRank" "Integrated--topRank"  "GTEx--Coexpression"   #> [4] "ReMap--ChIP-seq"      "Enrichr--Queries"     "ENCODE--ChIP-seq"     #> [7] "ARCHS4--Coexpression" "Literature--ChIP-seq"     head(results[["Integrated--meanRank"]]) #>     Query Name Rank      TF Score #> 1 rChEA3_query    1   FOSL2 62.60 #> 2 rChEA3_query    2    ETS2 74.25 #> 3 rChEA3_query    3  ZNF225 76.00 #> 4 rChEA3_query    4   RUNX1 81.00 #> 5 rChEA3_query    5  PLSCR1 89.00 #> 6 rChEA3_query    6 BHLHE40 93.75 #>                                                                                                     Library #> 1       ARCHS4 Coexpression,51;ENCODE ChIP-seq,105;Enrichr Queries,92;ReMap ChIP-seq,61;GTEx Coexpression,4 #> 2                     Literature ChIP-seq,148;ARCHS4 Coexpression,90;Enrichr Queries,52;GTEx Coexpression,7 #> 3                                                               ARCHS4 Coexpression,78;GTEx Coexpression,74 #> 4 Literature ChIP-seq,20;ARCHS4 Coexpression,56;Enrichr Queries,24;ReMap ChIP-seq,183;GTEx Coexpression,122 #> 5                                                              ARCHS4 Coexpression,76;GTEx Coexpression,102 #> 6                         ARCHS4 Coexpression,5;ENCODE ChIP-seq,43;ReMap ChIP-seq,180;GTEx Coexpression,147 #>             Overlapping_Genes #> 1 SMAD3,STAT1,MYC,STAT3,FOXO1 #> 2 SMAD3,STAT1,MYC,STAT3,FOXO1 #> 3                 STAT1,SMAD9 #> 4 SMAD3,STAT1,MYC,STAT3,FOXO1 #> 5                 STAT1,STAT3 #> 6     SMAD3,STAT1,STAT3,FOXO1 # }

what: Save a Visualization to File (PDF, PNG, or SVG) — saveViz
title: Save a Visualization to File (PDF, PNG, or SVG) — saveViz
text: function saves visualization object file specified format directory. supports visualizations generated chea3_visualizeRank(), ggplot2, plot object can rendered using print() inside graphics device. Optionally, current date (stored today variable) can prepended filename.

title: Save a Visualization to File (PDF, PNG, or SVG) — saveViz
code: saveViz(   viz,   output_dir,   output_file = "figure_rChEA3",   format = "pdf",   with_date = TRUE,   width = 8,   height = 5,   resolution = 300,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Save a Visualization to File (PDF, PNG, or SVG) — saveViz
text: viz visualization object typically created visualizeRank(), can also ggplot2 plot plot object printable print(). output_dir string specifying output directory. parameter required default. output_file string specifying base filename (without extension). Defaults "viz_rChEA3". format Output format. One "pdf", "png", "svg". Defaults "pdf". with_date Logical (default TRUE). Whether prepend current date (today) filename. width Width output file inches. Default 8. height Height output file inches. Default 5. resolution Resolution DPI (used PNG). Default 300. verbose Logical. TRUE, print message saved path. Default TRUE.

title: Save a Visualization to File (PDF, PNG, or SVG) — saveViz
text: visualization saved file disk. Invisibly returns full path saved file.

title: Save a Visualization to File (PDF, PNG, or SVG) — saveViz
code: # \donttest{     genes <- c("TP53", "MYC", "STAT3")     results <- queryChEA3(genes, verbose = FALSE)     meanRank_res <- results[["Integrated--meanRank"]]      # Create visualization     viz <- visualizeRank(meanRank_res)      # Save as PDF     saveViz(viz, output_dir = tempdir(), output_file = "chea3_results") #>  > Visualization (pdf) saved in /tmp/Rtmpj6UL3g/20251025_chea3_results.pdf      # Save as PNG with custom dimensions     saveViz(viz, output_dir = tempdir(), output_file = "chea3_results",             format = "png", width = 10, height = 6) #>  > Visualization (png) saved in /tmp/Rtmpj6UL3g/20251025_chea3_results.png # }

what: Today's Date at Package Load Time — today
title: Today's Date at Package Load Time — today
text: variable stores current date ("yyyymmdd" format) time package loaded. useful reproducible filenames (e.g., saveViz()), automatically set package attached.

title: Today's Date at Package Load Time — today
code: today

title: Today's Date at Package Load Time — today
text: character string (e.g., "20250908").

title: Today's Date at Package Load Time — today
code: # Print the date stored at package load library(rChEA3) today #> [1] "20251025"  # Use it in a filename paste0(today, "_rCHEA3_plot_meanRank.pdf") #> [1] "20251025_rCHEA3_plot_meanRank.pdf"

what: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
title: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
text: Create bar plot significant transcription factors ChEA3 result table. y-axis can based FDR, FET p-value, Score (integrated results). Bars ordered rank (Rank = 1 top).

title: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
code: visualizeRank(   df_result,   y_metric = c("auto", "FDR", "FET p-value", "Score"),   fdr_threshold = 0.05,   p_threshold = 0.05,   query_name = "myGeneList",   title_plot = "rChEA3 results (transcription factor enrichment analysis)",   top_n = 10,   fill_color = "#7AAACE" )

title: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
text: df_result ChEA3 result data frame. Must contain least columns: TF (transcription factor symbol), Rank (integer rank). Optionally: FDR, FET p-value, Score. y_metric Character; metric use y-axis. One : "auto" (default): use FDR present, otherwise FET p-value, otherwise Score. "FDR": use FDR (requires FDR column). "FET p-value": use Fisher’s exact test p-value (requires FET p-value column). "Score": use Score (used integrated meanRank/topRank). fdr_threshold Numeric; FDR cutoff significance (default 0.05). Used y_metric = "FDR". p_threshold Numeric; p-value cutoff significance (default 0.05). Used y_metric = "FET p-value". query_name Character; name input gene set, shown subtitle (default myGeneList) title_plot Character; main plot title (default rChEA3 results (transcription factor enrichment analysis)) top_n Integer; number TFs display (default 10). subtitle reports total number significant TFs, top_n rank plotted. fill_color Character; fill color bars (default "#7AAACE").

title: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
text: ggplot object.

title: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
text: plot subtitle automatically reports number significant TFs (filtering fdr_threshold p_threshold applicable), top_n controls many TFs displayed. integrated collections (Mean Rank Top Rank), subtitle shows descriptive label instead individual library names.

title: Visualize top transcription factors (TFs) from ChEA3 results — visualizeRank
code: # \donttest{ # Example with integrated meanRank results genes <- c("STAT3", "RELA", "MYC", "FOXO1", "TP53") results <- queryChEA3(genes, verbose = FALSE) meanRank_res <- results[["Integrated--meanRank"]] visualizeRank(meanRank_res, y_metric = "Score", top_n = 15)   # Example with ChIP-seq results (FET p-value-based) chip_res <- results[["ENCODE--ChIP-seq"]] visualizeRank(chip_res, y_metric = "FET p-value")  # }

title: rChEA3 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-10-15

title: rChEA3 0.2.0
text: version addresses CRAN reviewer comments initial submission: Formatting Software Names: Added single quotes around software/API names (‘ChEA3’) DESCRIPTION per CRAN guidelines References: Added web reference ChEA3 API (https://maayanlab.cloud/chea3/) original paper Keenan (2019) (doi:10.1093/nar/gkz446) DESCRIPTION Writing Files: Removed default paths exportResults() saveViz() functions. output_dir parameter now required (users must explicitly specify desired directory) comply CRAN policies

title: rChEA3 0.1.0
text: first release rChEA3, R client ChEA3 transcription factor enrichment API.

title: rChEA3 0.1.0
text: queryChEA3(): Query ChEA3 API gene lists identify enriched transcription factors Retrieves results 8 collections: integrated rankings (Mean Rank, Top Rank), ChIP-seq data (ENCODE, ReMap, Literature), co-expression (ARCHS4, GTEx), co-occurrence (Enrichr queries) displayTopN(): Display top-ranked transcription factors across collections Results organized evidence type formatted output visualizeRank(): Create publication-ready bar plots TF enrichment Automatic metric detection (FDR, p-value, Score) Customizable filtering display options exportResults(): Export results Excel workbooks one sheet per collection saveViz(): Save visualizations PDF, PNG, SVG format Automatic date stamping reproducible file names a549_dex_downreg: Example gene set A549 cells treated dexamethasone (15 downregulated genes)

title: rChEA3 0.1.0
text: Comprehensive vignette demonstrating full workflow Detailed function documentation README quick start guide

title: rChEA3 0.1.0
text: Please cite original ChEA3 publication using package: Keenan et al. (2019). “ChEA3: transcription factor enrichment analysis orthogonal omics integration.” Nucleic Acids Research, 47(W1), W212–W224. https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkz446
